comment: Literally everything on Quizlet. easy A.
She made sure she posted everything online and was very nice

Sitting in her lectures allowed me to get some of the best sleep of my life. They were extremely boring, monotone, and long-winded. I think I only went to 2 lectures and passed with an A. Extremely easy course. I essentially took it like an online asynchronous class. Just make sure to go to the review sessions before the tests, gives all the answer
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Doesn't want to be there. You will never be able to reach her. Hasn't responded to my email after following up numerous times. It has literally been 25 days. She is the worst instructor I have ever had. Ever. Avoid at all costs. She is not worth your time or the headache. A terrible teacher is terrible at what she does. 0/10.

Professor Green is very chill and I actually enjoyed her class. It's much easier if you show up. She appreciates those who do and put in the effort. Her slides are directly from the textbook and she doesn't make you pay for it. Her tests are a little hard sometimes, but they're mostly right from the notes. I wish I could take her class again!

Attendance is mandatory. I only showed up once and still finished with a high A. The classwork and assessments are all online so you have to keep up with deadlines. None of the assessments are lockdown. Homework is also very easy. It is very hard to not do well in this class.

Attendance is not mandatory, and the tests are fairly easy. Make sure to do the homework assignments because they're an easy grade booster. Always show up to review days because she goes over the test exactly. Take her if you can but be warned her lectures are very boring and she's always tired. Tests and quizzes are all done online.
Literally the easiest class I have ever taken. Barley any homework and quizzes and the test were all on Socratic and at home with no webcam
Study right from textbook and it be easy A. Textbook do study. From textbook. Four tests. One quiz. Week on homework.
TAKE HER!!!! so nice and kind and her tests and homework are so easy and managable

She was so funny and really got to individually know students and was always sweet when you would go up to ask questions in lab. She would always be very helpful when students were confused and answered emails rather quickly and we had a long time to complete everything.
the best professor ever

Everyone in my class that we had her for 1101 made fun of her a lot , I dont think her monotone is good but she is very caring and understanding and if you need anything she comes through for you, its a easy A , please take the class of you can! Shes super easy! And really understand and laid back

Although she doesn't answer questions too well when it comes to not knowing what to do in the labs, it is an easy grade. In general, you have to just figure it out most of the time but it is never impossible.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for Science 1102 barely showed up and still got a B+. Shes extremely caring and understanding, if you are going through something , just ask and shes more than willing to help you! She reopened all the MES assignments for everyone at the end of the semester for everyone and all of the tests

During her lecture, she has a monotone voice and clearly does not want to be there. The exams are easy from the get-go, but as you continue to go along, the tests will not make any sense even if you spend all of your time studying. She will take a week to get back to you if you email her, and she is not clear with her students.

Take this class. Very easy. We had 12 labs (you dont have to do them) just do the lab quizzes. And 4 exams. Final is not cumulative. All exams/quizzes were open and didnt require lockdown, nor were they timed. But even if they were go to her exam/lab reviews in class. You also have MES assignments, which can be time consuming but arent hard.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Green is a very laid back professor. She doesn't grade harshly. All you have to do is complete the work. One thing I didn't like about her was that for the final poster, she never said what is was about until A DAY BEFORE THE DUE DATE.

Mrs. Green is a very laid-back professor and very lenient. The only thing you need to do is show up for class (typical for a lab) and make sure you complete the work. The work is basically completion and she makes life very easy for hard semesters. If you need a GPA booster or just want to relax take her class.

Class is not very hard, open notes on exams and quizzes. My main issue is that she just reads off slides she did not even make for an hour every class. These same slides are posted online, so there's no reason to go to class. Thankfully attendance is not required, which is probably why about 15 of 184 students show up for class most of the time.

If you have the option to take Professor Green, TAKE HER. I cannot say enough great things about her. Her class is so straight forward, and the only class you NEED to go to is the class before your exam and lab quiz. She goes over ALL the questions for both the test and quiz. Genuinely one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. She is amazing!!

I loved this class! She made Biology enjoyable in terms of lab. In the beginning she give you an example manuscript to put in order just use that one to make all of your manuscripts and you will do fine. She is also really helpful in lab and outside and not a super tough grader. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!

TAKE HER!! 2020-2021 was SUPER TOUGH for everyone. She truly made it bearable for all of her students. She was very kind and understanding because of all that is going on in the world. Just listen to her lectures, go over slides, do the homework, attend her study session for tests, and you will pass! Easy peasy!
Very easy class, the modules required are time consuming but she gives you like a month to do it. Tests are all online, easy A

Professor Greens class is very easy to get either an A or B. My only complaint would be their is a lot of online homework modules. If I had done all of the homework I would have gotten an A. Overall she is very caring for her students and offers extra credit. She will do everything in her power to make sure you pass with a B or an A.
bests science teacher

Taken her twice, both A's. If you don't get at least a B, that's 100% on you. Pearson HW is opened up at end of semester if missed. Prequiz worth 10 extra points. Easyyyy tests. Use your resources and you'll get an A. Very laid back class. I highly recommend her.

She is super laid back. She makes it fun by making jokes and telling stories. All you do in class is go over power points and it is very boring but she prepares you really well for the tests and quizzes the class before you take them. that is really the only class you need to go to and you will get an A.

Just do your self the favor and take her. GPA boost. She is hilarious at times. She will try with her jokes. But for the course easy A; failing takes an effort. Just show up and study her study guides. also attendance leads to easy extra credit. 10/10 would take again.
Her class is basically just lectures and occasional jokes. She definitely cares about her students and knew what she was talking about. I would take her again for sure.

Her lectures are incredibly boring, but she makes the class easy. There are 5 homework assignments, 4 tests, and 5 quizzes that she practically gives the answers for the class before the test. Just study her given study guide and don't forget to do your work and you'll be fine. Famous word is "um".

She was a fun teacher to have. She made lectures entertaining with her bad jokes. I barely went to class and got an A. Half my class was online so you do not have to deal with annoying labs. All the lab answers are on Quizlet as well. If you do not at least get a B in the class, you are trying to fail.

Pretty basic gen-ed course. The lectures are long and boring, and the attendance isn't mandatory. Just be sure to do the homework, and COME TO CLASS THE DAY BEFORE TESTS. She gives a "review" session that is literally her going through each question and telling you exactly what you need to know.

Make sure you do your best on homework. Gives 10 bonus points for a pretest. Tests and quizzes almost exactly like her reviews. Easy to make an A if you focus on that. Don't need the textbook. Opens homework at end of semester. Easy A if you apply yourself.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: TAKE HER!! Ms. Green is very understanding and is so nice. She has you do online assignments on Pearsons that are always due the day of the test. She does review sessions before every test and the test are so stupid easy. She doesn't take attendance. 10/10 recommend.
